name: Samson H. Chowdhury
content:
Samson H. Chowdhury (Bengali: স্যামসন এইচ চৌধুরী; 25 September 1925 – 5 January 2012) was a Bangladeshi business magnate.[3] He was the chairman of Square Pharmaceuticals.[4][5]
 Samson H Chowdhury was born on 25 September 1925.[6] at Aruakandi in Gopalganj. After completing education at the Scottish Church College in Kolkata, India,[7] he returned to the then East Pakistan and settled at Ataikula village in Pabna district, where his father was working as a medical officer. In 1952, he started a small pharmacy in Ataikula village, which is about 160 km off capital Dhaka in the north-west part of Bangladesh. Chowdhury then ventured into a partnership pharmaceutical company with three of his friends in 1958. When asked why the name Square was chosen he remembers - "We named it SQUARE because it was started by four friends and also because it signifies accuracy and perfection meaning quality" as they committed in manufacturing quality.[citation needed]
 He served as a vice president of the Baptist World Alliance from 1985 to 1990.  In addition to being a BWA vice president, Chowdhury served in other areas of the global Baptist organization, including on the BWA General Council, the Executive Committee, the Baptist World Aid Committee, the Promotion and Development Committee, and the Memorial Committee.  Chowdhury was elected president of the Bangladesh Baptist Church Fellowship (BBCF) a dozen times, and was honorary general secretary for 14 years, between 1956 and 1969. He was a president of both the National Church Council of Bangladesh and the National Evangelical Alliance.[8]
 Samson H Chowdhury was buried at ASTRAS Firm House in Kashipur, Pabna.

Personal life[edit]
Samson H Chowdhury was born on 25 September 1925.[6] at Aruakandi in Gopalganj. After completing education at the Scottish Church College in Kolkata, India,[7] he returned to the then East Pakistan and settled at Ataikula village in Pabna district, where his father was working as a medical officer. In 1952, he started a small pharmacy in Ataikula village, which is about 160 km off capital Dhaka in the north-west part of Bangladesh. Chowdhury then ventured into a partnership pharmaceutical company with three of his friends in 1958. When asked why the name Square was chosen he remembers - "We named it SQUARE because it was started by four friends and also because it signifies accuracy and perfection meaning quality" as they committed in manufacturing quality.[citation needed]
He served as a vice president of the Baptist World Alliance from 1985 to 1990.  In addition to being a BWA vice president, Chowdhury served in other areas of the global Baptist organization, including on the BWA General Council, the Executive Committee, the Baptist World Aid Committee, the Promotion and Development Committee, and the Memorial Committee.  Chowdhury was elected president of the Bangladesh Baptist Church Fellowship (BBCF) a dozen times, and was honorary general secretary for 14 years, between 1956 and 1969. He was a president of both the National Church Council of Bangladesh and the National Evangelical Alliance.[8]

Burial[edit]
 High profiles are offering condolences to coffin at Square Premises in Pabna Town for Samson H. Chowdhury before his burial at ASTRAS Firm House in Kashipur, Pabna
Samson H Chowdhury was buried at ASTRAS Firm House in Kashipur, Pabna.

Positions[edit]
Chairman, Square Group
Chairman, Mutual Trust Bank board of directors [9]
Chairman, Astras Ltd.
Honorary Member, Kurmitola Golf Club, Dhaka
Former Vice President, Baptist World Alliance, 1985-1990 [10]
Former Chairman, Micro Industries Development & Services (MIDAS)
Chairman, Transparency International, Bangladesh Chapter, 2004–2007
President, Metropolitan Chamber of Commerce & Industries, Dhaka in 1996 and 1997
Vice-President: International Chamber of Commerce, Bangladesh
Former Director, The Federation of Bangladesh Chamber of Commerce & Industries (FBCCI)
Member, Executive Committee of Bangladesh French Chamber of Commerce and Industry
Director, Credit Rating Agency of Bangladesh[11]
Chairman, Central Depository Bangladesh Ltd
Member, Advisory Committee of the Bangladesh Association of Pharmaceutical Industries
Founder President, Bangladesh Association of Publicly Listed Companies
Chairman, Masrangaa Television, Bangladesh
